001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter.MetaschemaDataTypeProvider;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object.AmbiguousTime;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.impl.TimeWithoutTimeZoneItemImpl;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IAtomicOrUnionType;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.InvalidTypeMetapathException;
014
015import java.time.OffsetTime;
016
017import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
018
019/**
020 * An atomic Metapath item representing a time value in the Metapath system.
021 * <p>
022 * This interface provides functionality for handling time values with and
023 * without time zone information, supporting parsing, casting, and comparison
024 * operations. It works in conjunction with {@link AmbiguousTime} to properly
025 * handle time zone ambiguity.
026 */
027public interface ITimeItem extends IAnyAtomicItem {
028  /**
029   * Get the type information for this item.
030   *
031   * @return the type information
032   */
033  @NonNull
034  static IAtomicOrUnionType<ITimeItem> type() {
035    return MetaschemaDataTypeProvider.TIME.getItemType();
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  default IAtomicOrUnionType<? extends ITimeItem> getType() {
040    return type();
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Construct a new date/time item using the provided string {@code value}.
045   *
046   * @param value
047   *          a string representing a time
048   * @return the new item
049   */
050  @NonNull
051  static ITimeItem valueOf(@NonNull String value) {
052    try {
053      return valueOf(MetaschemaDataTypeProvider.TIME.parse(value));
054    } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
055      throw new InvalidTypeMetapathException(
056          null,
057          String.format("Invalid date/time value '%s'. %s",
058              value,
059              ex.getLocalizedMessage()),
060          ex);
061    }
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Construct a new time item using the provided {@code value}.
066   * <p>
067   * This method handles recording if an explicit timezone was provided using the
068   * {@code hasTimeZone} parameter. The {@link AmbiguousTime#hasTimeZone()} method
069   * can be called to determine if timezone information is present.
070   *
071   * @param value
072   *          a time, without time zone information
073   * @param hasTimeZone
074   *          {@code true} if the date/time is intended to have an associated time
075   *          zone or {@code false} otherwise
076   * @return the new item
077   * @see AmbiguousTime for more details on timezone handling
078   */
079  @NonNull
080  static ITimeItem valueOf(@NonNull OffsetTime value, boolean hasTimeZone) {
081    return hasTimeZone
082        ? ITimeWithTimeZoneItem.valueOf(value)
083        : valueOf(new AmbiguousTime(value, false));
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Construct a new time item using the provided {@code value}.
088   * <p>
089   * This method handles recording if an explicit timezone was provided using the
090   * {@link AmbiguousTime}. The {@link AmbiguousTime#hasTimeZone()} method can be
091   * called to determine if timezone information is present.
092   *
093   * @param value
094   *          a time, without time zone information
095   * @return the new item
096   * @see AmbiguousTime for more details on timezone handling
097   */
098  @NonNull
099  static ITimeItem valueOf(@NonNull AmbiguousTime value) {
100    return value.hasTimeZone()
101        ? ITimeWithTimeZoneItem.valueOf(value.getValue())
102        : new TimeWithoutTimeZoneItemImpl(value);
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Cast the provided type to this item type.
107   *
108   * @param item
109   *          the item to cast
110   * @return the original item if it is already this type, otherwise a new item
111   *         cast to this type
112   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
113   *           if the provided {@code item} cannot be cast to this type
114   */
115  @NonNull
116  static ITimeItem cast(@NonNull IAnyAtomicItem item) {
117    ITimeItem retval;
118    if (item instanceof ITimeItem) {
119      retval = (ITimeItem) item;
120    } else if (item instanceof IStringItem || item instanceof IUntypedAtomicItem) {
121      try {
122        retval = valueOf(item.asString());
123      } catch (IllegalStateException | InvalidTypeMetapathException ex) {
124        // asString can throw IllegalStateException exception
125        throw new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(ex);
126      }
127    } else {
128      throw new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(
129          String.format("unsupported item type '%s'", item.getClass().getName()));
130    }
131    return retval;
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Determine if the temporal item has a timezone.
136   *
137   * @return {@code true} if the temporal item has a timezone or {@code false}
138   *         otherwise
139   */
140  boolean hasTimezone();
141
142  /**
143   * Get the underlying time value.
144   *
145   * @return the time value
146   */
147  @NonNull
148  OffsetTime asOffsetTime();
149
150  @Override
151  default ITimeItem castAsType(IAnyAtomicItem item) {
152    return cast(item);
153  }
154
155  @Override
156  default int compareTo(IAnyAtomicItem item) {
157    return asOffsetTime().compareTo(cast(item).asOffsetTime());
158  }
159}
